WorkItem.ClosedComment: This is out of scope. However, replacing <p>, <br>, ... can be a solution. ANother solution may be to convert certain HTML tags into, for example, PHPExcel style directives. So <font color=red> translates into a call setting the run font in red color.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi, I am currently creating a spreadsheet that wants to include text from the database. This is generated via the use of a rich text editor (tinyMCE) which produces a pure html output. What I want is for line breaks to properly appear (be that by replacing the html

tags). I also want to be able to use the bullet-point lists in the spreadsheet as well (

  • ). Does anyone have any suggestions?
WorkItem.Summary: Inserting HTML encoded string into cell

Comments.Message: Perhaps some library that can convert HTML to plain text to handle the intermediate conversion? Maybe this is outside the scope for inclusion in PHPExcel?
